body:
Comment 2: 
The following produces a compile error of "4: false not used":

package main

func main() {
	if 1 == 2
	{ println("true") }
}


An argument could be made that the following should produce an error like "expression 
not used":

package main

func foo() bool {
        return false
}

func main() {
        if foo()
        { println("true") }
}
_Owner changed to **a...@golang.org**._ _Status changed to **Thinking**._
